title: Haloalkanes & Haloarenes
description: A comprehensive study of compounds where halogen atoms replace hydrogen in aliphatic (haloalkanes) or aromatic (haloarenes) hydrocarbons.
notes: Core Organic Chemistry - Unit 10. Focus on SN1/SN2 mechanisms.

children.title: Classification
children.description: Compounds are classified based on the number of halogen atoms (mono, di, poly) and the nature of C-X bond hybridization (sp3 or sp2).
children.notes: Distinguish between Allylic, Benzylic, Vinylic, and Aryl halides.

children.title: sp3 C-X compounds
children.description: Halogen is attached to an sp3 hybridized carbon atom. Types include Primary (1°), Secondary (2°), and Tertiary (3°).

children.title: sp2 C-X compounds
children.description: Halogen is attached to an sp2 hybridized carbon atom of a carbon-carbon double bond or aromatic ring.
children.notes: Aryl halides are less reactive towards nucleophilic substitution.

children.title: Preparation
children.description: Various routes to synthesize organic halides from alcohols, hydrocarbons, and other precursors.
children.notes: Focus on Markovnikov's and Anti-Markovnikov's rules.

children.title: From Alcohols
children.description: Reaction of alcohols with HX, PX3, PX5, or SOCl2. Thionyl chloride (SOCl2) is preferred as side products are gaseous.
children.notes: SOCl2 method is the best for pure alkyl halides.

children.title: From Hydrocarbons
children.description: Free radical halogenation of alkanes or electrophilic addition to alkenes (H-X or X2 addition).
children.notes: Finkelstein and Swarts reactions for halogen exchange.

children.title: Chemical Reactions
children.description: Study of chemical transformations including Nucleophilic Substitution, Elimination, and reactions with metals.
children.notes: SN1 vs SN2 is a high-yield topic.

children.title: Substitutions (SN)
children.description: Nucleophilic substitution where one nucleophile replaces another. SN2 is a single-step concerted process; SN1 is a two-step process via carbocation.
children.notes: SN2 shows inversion of configuration (Walden Inversion).

children.title: Elimination
children.description: Removal of hydrogen and halogen from adjacent carbons to form an alkene. Follows Saytzeff's Rule.
children.notes: Requires alcoholic KOH or stronger base.

children.title: With Metals
children.description: Formation of Grignard Reagents (R-Mg-X) and coupling reactions like Wurtz, Wurtz-Fittig, and Fittig reactions.
children.notes: Dry ether is essential as a solvent.
